page.title: 13CHARLTON BUS GARAGE
page.content: The Charlton bus service is very important because some people don't have cars and they need to get to work or get their shopping,also some of the children use it to get to school.Charlton services started in 1920 when Mr Knight owned it.It was first used to carry parcels,people gave the bus driver their shopping list and he went into Oxford and bought their shopping for them.The present owner has owned it since 1955.There were 5 buses then,now there are 14.The Bus Garage was built in 1942.It is used to paint and repair the buses. One old Charlton bus has been turned into a restaurant and the Marston Scouts use another old bus.It costs quite a lot to keep a bus,each bus uses 14000l of diesel a month,tyres and engines are very expensive.The buses are cleaned everyday.
